item.title: Simple Haskell Automation in Emacs
item.description: I am working through the amazing Data 61 Functional Programming Course (seriously, put it on your list!) and I found myself doing a repeated set of actions. Repeated sets of actions are perfect for automation! The course has some sections with comments indicating the expected behavior: -- >>> parse (satisfyAll (isUpper :. (/= 'X') :. Nil)) "ABC" -- Result >BC< 'A' -- -- >>> isErrorResult (parse (satisfyAll (isUpper :. (/= 'X') :.
